text: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful;
speaker: Narrator

text: but his delight is in the law of the Lord, and on His law doth he meditate day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither, and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ungodly are not so, but are like the chaff which the wind driveth away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord knoweth the way of the righteous, but the way of the ungodly shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do the heathen rage, and the people devise a vain thing?
speaker: Narrator

text: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the Lord and against His Anointed, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let us break Their bonds asunder, and cast away Their cords from us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh; the Lord shall hold them in derision.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall He speak unto them in His wrath, and vex them in His sore displeasure:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yet have I set My King upon My holy hill of Zion.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “I will declare the decree: The Lord hath said unto Me, ‘Thou art My Son; this day have I begotten Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask of Me, and I shall give Thee the heathen for Thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for Thy possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; Thou shalt dash them to pieces like a potter’s vessel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings; be instructed, ye judges of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Serve the Lord with fear and rejoice with trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kiss the Son, lest He be angry and ye perish from the way, when His wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how they have increased that trouble me! Many are they that rise up against me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Many there be that say of my soul, “There is no help for him in God.” Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou, O Lord, art a shield for me, my glory and the lifter up of mine head.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried unto the Lord with my voice, and He heard me from His holy hill. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: I laid me down and slept; I awaked, for the Lord sustained me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people that have set themselves against me round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Lord! Save me, O my God! For Thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheekbone; Thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salvation belongeth unto the Lord. Thy blessing is upon Thy people. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness! Thou hast set me at large when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame? How long will ye love vanity and seek after lies? Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: But know that the Lord hath set apart him that is godly for Himself; the Lord will hear when I call unto Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand in awe, and sin not; commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are many that say, “Who will show us any good?” Lord, lift Thou up the light of Thy countenance upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time when their corn and wine increased.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep; for Thou Lord only, makest me dwell in safety.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ear to my words, O Lord; consider my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King and my God, for unto Thee will I pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: My voice shalt Thou hear in the morning, O Lord; in the morning will I direct my prayer unto Thee and will look up.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness; neither shall evil dwell with Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foolish shall not stand in Thy sight; Thou hatest all workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt destroy them that speak lies; the Lord will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, I will come into Thy house in the multitude of Thy mercy, and in Thy fear will I worship toward Thy holy temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lead me, O Lord, in Thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make Thy way straight before my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part is exceeding wickedness. Their throat is an open sepulcher; they flatter with their tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Destroy Thou them, O God! Let them fall by their own counsels. Cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions, for they have rebelled against Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let all those that put their trust in Thee rejoice; let them ever shout for joy, because Thou defendest them; let them also that love Thy name be joyful in Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou, Lord, wilt bless the righteous; with favor wilt Thou compass him about as with a shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, rebuke me not in Thine anger, neither chasten me in Thy hot displeasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am weak; O Lord, heal me, for my bones are vexed.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is also sore vexed, but Thou, O Lord, how long?
speaker: Narrator

text: Return, O Lord, deliver my soul! O save me for Thy mercies’ sake!
speaker: Narrator

text: For in death there is no remembrance of Thee; in the grave who shall give Thee thanks?
speaker: Narrator

text: I am weary with my groaning; all the night I make my bed to swim, I water my couch with my tears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity, for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath heard my supplication; the Lord will receive my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sorely vexed; let them turn back and be put to shame suddenly.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, in Thee do I put my trust. Save me from all them that persecute me; and deliver me,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest they tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces while there is none to deliver.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, if I have done this, if there be iniquity on my hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: if I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy),
speaker: Narrator

text: let the enemy persecute my soul and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honor in the dust. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Lord, in Thine anger; lift up Thyself against the rage of mine enemies, and awaken for me the judgment that Thou hast commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall the congregation of the people compass Thee about; for their sakes, therefore, return Thou on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall judge the people: Judge me, O Lord, according to my righteousness and according to mine integrity that is in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, but establish the just; for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.
speaker: Narrator

text: My defense is of God, who saveth the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he turn not, He will whet His sword; He hath bent His bow and made it ready.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath also prepared for Him the instruments of death; He ordaineth His arrows against the persecutors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the wicked travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief and brought forth falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a pit and dug it, and has fallen into the ditch which he hath made.
speaker: Narrator

text: His mischief shall return upon his own head; and his violent dealings shall come down upon his own pate.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise the Lord according to His righteousness, and will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, our Lord, how excellent is Thy name in all the earth, who hast set Thy glory above the heavens!
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast Thou ordained strength because of Thine enemies, that Thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I consider Thy heavens, the work of Thy fingers, the moon and the stars which Thou hast ordained,
speaker: Narrator

text: what is man that Thou art mindful of him, and the son of man that Thou dost visit him?
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast made him a little lower than the angels, and hast crowned him with glory and honor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made him to have dominion over the works of Thy hands; Thou hast put all things under his feet,
speaker: Narrator

text: all sheep and oxen, yea, and the beasts of the field,
speaker: Narrator

text: the fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatsoever passeth through the paths of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, our Lord, how excellent is Thy name in all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise Thee, O Lord, with my whole heart; I will show forth all Thy marvelous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad and rejoice in Thee; I will sing praise to Thy name, O Thou Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at Thy presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast maintained my right and my cause; Thou sittest on the throne judging right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, Thou hast destroyed the wicked; Thou hast blotted out their name for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and Thou hast destroyed their cities; their memorial is perished with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord shall endure for ever; He hath prepared His throne for judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He shall judge the world with righteousness; He shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they that know Thy name will put their trust in Thee; for Thou, Lord, hast not forsaken them that seek Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises to the Lord who dwelleth in Zion! Declare among the people His doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He maketh inquisition for blood, He remembereth them; He forgetteth not the cry of the humble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O Lord! Consider my trouble which I suffer from them that hate me, Thou that liftest me up from the gates of death,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may show forth all Thy praise at the gates of the daughter of Zion. I will rejoice in Thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heathen have sunk down into the pit that they made; in the net which they hid, their own foot is taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is known by the judgment which He executeth; the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the needy shall not always be forgotten; the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Lord, let not man prevail; let the heathen be judged in Thy sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put them in fear, O Lord; that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Why standest Thou afar off, O Lord? Why hidest Thou Thyself in times of trouble?
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor; let them be caught in the devices that they have contrived.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth the covetous whom the Lord abhorreth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked, in the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God; God is not in all his thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text: His ways are always grievous; Thy judgments are far above, out of his sight; as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath said in his heart, “I shall not be moved, for I shall never be in adversity.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud; under his tongue is mischief and vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages; in secret places doth he murder the innocent; his eyes are privily set against the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den; he lieth in wait to catch the poor; he doth catch the poor when he draweth him into his net.
speaker: Narrator

text: He croucheth and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath said in his heart, “God hath forgotten; He hideth His face, He will never see it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Lord! O God, lift up Thine hand! Forget not the humble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why doth the wicked contemn God? He hath said in his heart, “Thou wilt not keep account.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou hast seen it, for Thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with Thy hand. The poor committeth himself unto Thee; Thou art the helper of the fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Break Thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man; seek out his wickedness until Thou find none.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is King for ever and ever; the heathen have perished out of His land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, Thou hast heard the desire of the humble; Thou wilt prepare their heart, Thou wilt cause Thine ear to hear,
speaker: Narrator

text: to judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the Lord I put my trust; how say ye to my soul, “Flee as a bird to your mountain,
speaker: Narrator

text: for lo, the wicked bend their bow and make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart;
speaker: Narrator

text: if the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is in His holy temple! The Lord’S throne is in heaven! His eyes behold; His eyelids test the children of men!
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord trieth the righteous; but the wicked and him that loveth violence, His soul hateth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon the wicked He shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and a horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness; His countenance doth behold the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Help, Lord, for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: They speak vanity every one with his neighbor; with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things,
speaker: Narrator

text: who have said, “With our tongue, we will prevail; our lips are our own; who is lord over us?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise,” saith the Lord; “I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of the Lord are pure words, as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt keep them, O Lord; Thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long wilt Thou forget me, O Lord? For ever? How long wilt Thou hide Thy face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? How long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider and hear me, O Lord my God; lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;
speaker: Narrator

text: lest mine enemy say, “I have prevailed against him”; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have trusted in Thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in Thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing unto the Lord, because He hath dealt bountifully with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fool hath said in his heart, “There is no God.” They are corrupt; they have done abominable works; there is none that doeth good.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand and seek God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have all turned aside; they are all together become filthy. There is none that doeth good; no, not one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge, who eat up my people as they eat bread and call not upon the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: There were they in great fear, for God is in the generation of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the Lord is his refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! When the Lord bringeth back His people from captivity, Jacob shall rejoice and Israel shall be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, who shall abide in Thy tabernacle? Who shall dwell in Thy holy hill?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that walketh uprightly and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart;
speaker: Narrator

text: he that backbiteth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbor, nor spreadeth a reproach against his neighbor;
speaker: Narrator

text: in whose eyes a vile person is contemned, but he honoreth them that fear the Lord; he that taketh an oath to his own hurt, and changeth not;
speaker: Narrator

text: he that putteth not out his money to usury, nor taketh a bribe against the innocent. He that doeth these things shall never be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Preserve me, O God, for in Thee do I put my trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my soul, thou hast said unto the Lord, “Thou art my Lord; my goodness extendeth not to Thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: but to the saints that are on the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Their sorrows shall be multiplied, that hasten after another god; their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take up their names upon my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup; Thou maintainest my lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; yea, I have a goodly heritage.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bless the Lord who hath given me counsel; my reins also instruct me in the night seasons.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have set the Lord always before me; because He is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my heart is glad and my spirit rejoiceth; my flesh also shall rest in hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt Thou suffer Thine Holy One to see corruption.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt show me the path of life; in Thy presence is fullness of joy; at Thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the right, O Lord; attend unto my cry! Give ear unto my prayer, which goeth not out of feigned lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my sentence come forth from Thy presence; let Thine eyes behold things with equity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast tested mine heart; Thou hast visited me in the night; Thou hast tried me and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning the works of men, by the word of Thy lips I have been kept from the paths of the destroyer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Uphold my goings in Thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have called upon Thee, for Thou wilt hear me, O God; incline Thine ear unto me and hear my speaking.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show Thy marvelous lovingkindness, O Thou that savest by Thy right hand them that put their trust in Thee from those that rise up against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me as the apple of the eye; hide me under the shadow of Thy wings,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies who compass me about.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are enclosed in their own fat; with their mouth they speak proudly.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have now encompassed us in our steps; they have set their eyes, bowing down to the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: like a lion that is greedy for his prey, even as a young lion lurking in secret places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Lord, disappoint them! Cast them down; deliver my soul from the wicked by Thy sword,
speaker: Narrator

text: from men which are Thy hand, O Lord, from men of the world that have their portion in this life, and whose belly Thou fillest with Thy hid treasure: They are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, I will behold Thy face in righteousness; I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with Thy likeness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will love Thee, O Lord, my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will call upon the Lord, who is worthy to be praised; so shall I be saved from mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sorrows of death encompassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sorrows of hell compassed me about; the snares of death lay before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In my distress I called upon the Lord and cried unto my God; He heard my voice out of His temple, and my cry came before Him, even unto His ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken, because He was wroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: There went up smoke out of His nostrils, and a devouring fire out of His mouth; coals were kindled by it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He bowed the heavens also and came down; and darkness was under His feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He rode upon a cherub and flew; yea, He flew upon the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made darkness His secret place; His pavilion round about Him was dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the brightness that was before Him, His thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest uttered His voice with hail stones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, He sent out His arrows and scattered them; and He shot out lightnings and discomfited them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the channels of the waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were uncovered at Thy rebuke, O Lord, at the blast of the breath of Thy nostrils.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent from above, He took me; He drew me out of many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them that hated me, for they were too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came against me in the day of my calamity; but the Lord was my stay.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me forth also into a large place; He delivered me, because He delighted in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath He recompensed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have kept the ways of the Lord, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all His judgments were before me, and I did not put away His statutes from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was also upright before Him, and I kept myself from mine iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hath the Lord recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in His eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the merciful Thou wilt show Thyself merciful; with an upright man Thou wilt show Thyself upright;
speaker: Narrator

text: with the pure Thou wilt show Thyself pure; and with the froward Thou wilt show Thyself froward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou wilt save the afflicted people, but wilt bring down haughty looks.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou wilt light my candle; the Lord my God will enlighten my darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by Thee I have run through a troop; and by my God have I leaped over a wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for God, His way is perfect; the word of the Lord is proved; He is a buckler to all those that trust in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who is God, except the Lord? Or who is a rock, except our God?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh my feet like hinds’ feet, and setteth me upon my high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: He teacheth my hands to war, so that the bow of steel is broken by mine arms.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast also given me the shield of Thy salvation; Thy right hand hath held me up, and Thy gentleness hath made me great.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast enlarged my path under me, that my feet did not slip.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have pursued mine enemies and overtaken them; neither did I turn back until they were consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have wounded them, that they were not able to rise; they have fallen under my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast girded me with strength for the battle; Thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies, that I might destroy them that hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried, but there was none to save them, even unto the Lord, but He answered them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind; I did cast them out as the dirt in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; and Thou hast made me the head of the heathen; a people whom I have not known shall serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me; the strangers shall submit themselves unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The strangers shall fade away, and be afraid out of their close places.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord liveth, and blessed be my Rock! And let the God of my salvation be exalted!
speaker: Narrator

text: It is God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me;
speaker: Narrator

text: He delivereth me from mine enemies. Yea, Thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me; Thou hast delivered me from violent men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore will I give thanks unto Thee, O Lord, among the heathen, and sing praises unto Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great deliverance giveth He to His king and showeth mercy to His anointed, to David and to his seed for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament showeth His handiwork.
speaker: Narrator

text: Day upon day uttereth speech, and night upon night showeth knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no speech nor language where their voice is not heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their sound has gone forth through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath He set a tabernacle for the sun,
speaker: Narrator

text: which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.
speaker: Narrator

text: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it; and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law of the Lord is perfect, converting the soul; the testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text: The statutes of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart; the commandment of the Lord is pure, enlightening the eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the Lord is clean, enduring for ever; the judgments of the Lord are true and righteous altogether.
speaker: Narrator

text: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold; sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover by them is Thy servant warned, and in keeping of them there is great reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can understand his errors? Cleanse Thou me from secret faults.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep back Thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me. Then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent of the great transgression.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in Thy sight, O Lord, my Strength and my Redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hear thee in the day of trouble! The name of the God of Jacob defend thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: May He send thee help from the sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: May He remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: May He grant thee according to thine own heart, and fulfill all thy counsel.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners; the Lord fulfill all thy petitions!
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I know that the Lord saveth His anointed; He will hear him from His holy heaven with the saving strength of His right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses; but we will remember the name of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are brought down and fallen; but we are risen and stand upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save us, Lord! Let the King hear us when we call.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king shall rejoice in Thy strength, O Lord; and in Thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not withheld the request of his lips. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou goest before him with the blessings of goodness; Thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked life of Thee and Thou gavest it to him, even length of days for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: His glory is great in Thy salvation; honor and majesty hast Thou laid upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast made him most blessed for ever; Thou hast made him exceeding glad with Thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the king trusteth in the Lord, and through the mercy of the Most High he shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine hand shall find out all Thine enemies; Thy right hand shall find out those that hate Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of Thine anger; the Lord shall swallow them up in His wrath, and the fire shall devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their fruit shalt Thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they intended evil against Thee; they contrived a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shalt Thou make them turn their back when Thou shalt ready Thine arrows upon Thy strings against the face of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be Thou exalted, Lord, in Thine own strength; so will we sing and praise Thy power!
speaker: Narrator

text: My God, My God, why hast Thou forsaken Me? Why art Thou so far from helping Me, and from the words of My groaning?
speaker: Narrator

text: O My God, I cry in the daytime, but Thou hearest not; and in the night season I am not silent.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou art holy, O Thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers trusted in Thee; they trusted, and Thou didst deliver them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried unto Thee and were delivered; they trusted in Thee and were not confounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am a worm and no man, a reproach of men and despised by the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: All they that see Me laugh Me to scorn; they shoot out their lip, they shake their head, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “He trusted in the Lord that He would deliver him; let Him deliver him, seeing He delighted in him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou art He that took Me out of the womb; Thou didst make Me hope when I was upon My mother’s breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was cast upon Thee from the womb; Thou art My God from My mother’s belly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not far from Me, for trouble is near; for there is none to help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many bulls have compassed Me about; strong bulls of Bashan have beset Me round.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gaped at Me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am poured out like water, and all My bones are out of joint; My heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of My body.
speaker: Narrator

text: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and My tongue cleaveth to My jaws; and Thou hast brought Me into the dust of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For dogs have surrounded Me; the assembly of the wicked have enclosed Me; they pierced My hands and My feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: I can count all My bones; they look and stare upon Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They part My garments among them, and cast lots upon My vesture.
speaker: Narrator

text: But be Thou not far from Me, O Lord; O My Strength, hasten Thee to help Me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver My soul from the sword, My only one from the power of the dog.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save Me from the lion’s mouth; for Thou hast heard Me from the horns of the unicorns.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will declare Thy name unto My brethren; in the midst of the congregation will I praise Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that fear the Lord, praise Him! All ye the seed of Jacob, glorify Him; and fear Him, all ye the seed of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath He hid His face from Him, but when He cried unto Him, He heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: My praise shall be of Thee in the great congregation; I will pay My vows before them that fear Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The meek shall eat and be satisfied; they shall praise the Lord that seek Him. Your heart shall live for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the Lord, and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the kingdom is the Lord’S, and He is the governor among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: All they that are fat upon the earth shall eat and worship; all they that go down to the dust shall bow before Him, for none can keep alive his own soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: A seed shall serve Him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall come and shall declare His righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that He hath done this.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures; He leadeth me beside the still waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: He restoreth my soul; He leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for His name’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for Thou art with me; Thy rod and Thy staff, they comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies; Thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life; and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth is the Lord’S, and the fullness thereof, the world and they that dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath founded it upon the seas, and established it upon the floods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who shall ascend onto the hill of the Lord? Or who shall stand in His Holy Place?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that hath clean hands and a pure heart, who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall receive the blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such is the generation of them that seek Him, that seek Thy face, O God of Jacob. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your heads, O ye gates! And be ye lifted up, ye everlasting doors! And the King of glory shall come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is this King of glory? The Lord strong and mighty, the Lord mighty in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your heads, O ye gates! Even lift them up, ye everlasting doors! And the King of glory shall come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is this King of glory? The Lord of hosts, He is the King of glory. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul;
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, I trust in Thee. Let me not be ashamed; let not mine enemies triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, let none that wait on Thee be ashamed; let them be ashamed that transgress without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me Thy ways, O Lord; teach me Thy paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lead me in Thy truth and teach me, for Thou art the God of my salvation; on Thee do I wait all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, O Lord, Thy tender mercies and Thy lovingkindnesses; for they have been ever of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions; according to Thy mercy remember Thou me, for Thy goodness’ sake, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good and upright is the Lord; therefore will He teach sinners in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: The meek will He guide in judgment, and the meek will He teach His way.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the paths of the Lord are mercy and truth, unto them that keep His covenant and His testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thy name’s sake, O Lord, pardon mine iniquity, for it is great.
speaker: Narrator

text: What man is he that feareth the Lord? Him shall He teach in the way that He shall choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: His soul shall dwell at ease, and his seed shall inherit the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The secret of the Lord is with them that fear Him, and He will show them His covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes are ever toward the Lord, for He shall pluck my feet out of the net.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn Thee unto me and have mercy upon me, for I am desolate and afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text: The troubles of my heart are enlarged; O bring Thou me out of my distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look upon mine affliction and my pain, and forgive all my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider mine enemies, for they are many; they hate me with cruel hatred.
speaker: Narrator

text: O keep my soul and deliver me; let me not be ashamed, for I put my trust in Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, for I wait on Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Redeem Israel, O God, out of all his troubles!
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me, O Lord, for I have walked in mine integrity. I have also trusted in the Lord; therefore I shall not slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: Examine me, O Lord, and test me; try my reins and my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thy lovingkindness is before mine eyes, and I have walked in Thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not sat with vain persons, neither will I consort with dissemblers.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have hated the congregation of evildoers, and will not sit with the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will wash mine hands in innocence; so will I compass Thine altar, O Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may proclaim with the voice of thanksgiving, and tell of all Thy wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, I have loved the habitation of Thy house, and the place where Thine honor dwelleth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather not my soul with sinners, nor my life with bloody men,
speaker: Narrator

text: in whose hands is mischief, and their right hand is full of bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity; redeem me and be merciful unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My foot standeth on a level place; in the congregations will I bless the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? The Lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though an army should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear; though war should rise against me, even in this will I be confident.
speaker: Narrator

text: One thing have I desired of the Lord; that will I seek after: that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the Lord and to inquire in His temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the time of trouble He shall hide me in His pavilion; in the secret places of His tabernacle shall He hide me; He shall set me upon a rock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me; therefore I will offer in His tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Lord, when I cry with my voice! Have mercy also upon me and answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Thou saidst, “Seek ye My face,” my heart said unto Thee, “Thy face, Lord, will I seek.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide not Thy face far from me; put not Thy servant away in anger. Thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the Lord will take me up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me Thy way, O Lord, and lead me in a level path because of mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies; for false witnesses have risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would have fainted, unless I had believed that I would see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wait on the Lord; be of good courage, and He shall strengthen thine heart. Wait, I say, on the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Thee will I cry, O Lord my rock; be not silent to me, lest, if Thou be silent, I become like them that go down into the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the voice of my supplications when I cry unto Thee, when I lift up my hands toward the oracle of Thy sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw me not away with the wicked and with the workers of iniquity, who speak peace to their neighbors, but mischief is in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to them according to their deeds and according to the wickedness of their endeavors; give to them according to the work of their hands; render to them their deserts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they regard not the works of the Lord, nor the operation of His hands, He shall destroy them and not build them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord, because He hath heard the voice of my supplications!
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in Him, and I am helped. Therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth, and with my song will I praise Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is their strength, and He is the saving strength of His anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save the people, and bless Thine inheritance; feed them also, and lift them up forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the Lord, O ye mighty; give unto the Lord glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the Lord the glory due unto His name; worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord is upon the waters; the God of glory thundereth; the Lord is upon many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord is powerful; the voice of the Lord is full of majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedars; yea, the Lord breaketh the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh them also to skip like a calf, Lebanon and Sirion like a young unicorn.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord divideth the flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord shaketh the wilderness; the Lord shaketh the Wilderness of Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord maketh the hinds to calve, and layeth bare the forests, and in His temple doth every one speak of His glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord sitteth over the flood; yea, the Lord sitteth as King for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will give strength unto His people; the Lord will bless His people with peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will extol Thee, O Lord, for Thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, I cried unto Thee, and Thou hast healed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, Thou hast brought up my soul from the grave; Thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord, O ye His saints, and give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For His anger endureth but a moment, and in His favor is life; weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in my prosperity I said, “I shall never be moved.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, by Thy favor Thou hast made my mountain to stand strong; when Thou didst hide Thy face, I was troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried to Thee, O Lord; and unto the Lord I made supplication:
speaker: Narrator

text: “What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise Thee? Shall it declare Thy truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me; Lord, be Thou my helper!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing; Thou hast put off my sackcloth and girded me with gladness,
speaker: Narrator

text: to the end that my glory may sing praise to Thee and not be silent. O Lord my God, I will give thanks unto Thee for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Thee, O Lord, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed; deliver me in Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bow down Thine ear to me, deliver me speedily; be Thou my strong rock, a house of defense to save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for the sake of Thy name, lead me and guide me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me, for Thou art my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Into Thine hand I commit my spirit; Thou hast redeemed me, O Lord God of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have hated them that have regard for lying vanities; but I trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad and rejoice in Thy mercy, for Thou hast considered my trouble. Thou hast known my soul in adversities,
speaker: Narrator

text: And hast not delivered me into the hands of the enemy; Thou hast set my feet in a large room.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am in trouble; mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing; my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbors, and a fear to mine acquaintances; they that see me in the streets flee from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am forgotten as a dead man, out of mind; I am like a broken vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have heard the slander of many; fear was on every side; while they took counsel together against me, they schemed to take away my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have trusted in Thee, O Lord; I said, “Thou art my God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: My times are in Thy hand; deliver me from the hand of mine enemies and from them that persecute me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make Thy face to shine upon Thy servant; save me for Thy mercies’ sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me not be ashamed, O Lord, for I have called upon Thee; let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the lying lips be put to silence, which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: O how great is Thy goodness which Thou hast laid up for them that fear Thee, which Thou hast wrought for them that trust in Thee before the sons of men!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt hide them in the safety of Thy presence from the pride of man; Thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord, for He hath shown me His marvelous kindness in a stronghold city!
speaker: Narrator

text: For I said in my haste, “I am cut off from before Thine eyes!” Nevertheless Thou heard the voice of my supplications when I cried unto Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O love the Lord, all ye His saints! For the Lord preserveth the faithful, but plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be of good courage, and He shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man unto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I kept silent, my bones waxed old through my groaning all the day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: For day and night Thy hand was heavy upon me; the sap of my soul was turned into the drought of summer. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: I acknowledged my sin unto Thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, “I will confess my transgressions unto the Lord,” and Thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: For this shall every one that is godly pray unto Thee in a time when Thou mayest be found; surely the floods of great waters shall not come nigh unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my hiding place; Thou shalt preserve me from trouble; Thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: “I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go; I will guide thee with Mine eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye not as the horse or as the mule which have no understanding, whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, lest they not come near unto thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Many shall be the sorrows of the wicked; but he that trusteth in the Lord, mercy shall compass him about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be glad in the Lord and rejoice, ye righteous; and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart!
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the Lord, O ye righteous! For praise is comely for the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord with the harp; sing unto Him with the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto Him a new song; play skillfully with a loud noise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the word of the Lord is right, and all His works are done in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He loveth righteousness and judgment; the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made, and all the host of them by the breath of His mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as a heap; He layeth up the deep in storehouses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all the earth fear the Lord; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He spoke, and it was done; He commanded, and it stood fast.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought; He maketh the devices of the people of no effect.
speaker: Narrator

text: The counsel of the Lord standeth for ever, the thoughts of His heart to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord, and the people whom He hath chosen for His own inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord looketh down from heaven; He beholdeth all of the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the place of His habitation He looketh upon all the inhabitants of the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text: He fashioneth the hearts of all; He considereth all their works.
speaker: Narrator

text: No king is saved by the multitude of an army; a mighty man is not delivered by much strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: A horse is a vain thing for safety; neither shall he deliver any by his great strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon them that fear Him, upon them that hope in His mercy,
speaker: Narrator

text: to deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul waiteth for the Lord; He is our help and our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our heart shall rejoice in Him, because we have trusted in His holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Thy mercy, O Lord, be upon us, according as we hope in Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bless the Lord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul shall make her boast in the Lord; the humble shall hear thereof and be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: O magnify the Lord with me, and let us exalt His name together.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sought the Lord, and He heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.
speaker: Narrator

text: They looked unto Him and were lightened, and their faces were not ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the Lord encampeth round about them that fear Him, and delivereth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O taste and see that the Lord is good; blessed is the man that trusteth in Him!
speaker: Narrator

text: O fear the Lord, ye His saints! For them that fear Him suffer no want.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young lions lack and suffer hunger, but they that seek the Lord shall not want any good thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, ye children, hearken unto me; I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: What man is he that desireth life, and loveth many days, that he may see good?
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart from evil and do good; seek peace and pursue it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and His ears are open unto their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: The face of the Lord is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart, and saveth such as are of a contrite spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the Lord delivereth him out of them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: He keepeth all his bones; not one of them is broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Evil shall slay the wicked, and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord redeemeth the soul of His servants, and none of them that trust in Him shall be desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Plead my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me; fight against them that fight against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw out also the spear, and block the way against them that persecute me. Say unto my soul, “I am thy salvation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul; let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be as chaff before the wind, and let the angel of the Lord chase them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their way be dark and slippery, and let the angel of the Lord persecute them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For without cause they have hid their net for me in a pit, which without cause they have dug for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let destruction come upon him unawares; and let the net which he hath hidden catch himself; into that very destruction let him fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then my soul shall be joyful in the Lord; it shall rejoice in His salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: All my bones shall say, “Lord, who is like unto Thee, who deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and needy from him that would plunder him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: False witnesses rose up; they laid to my charge things that I knew not.
speaker: Narrator

text: They rewarded me evil for good, to the grieving of my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, when they were sick my clothing was sackcloth; I humbled my soul with fasting, and my prayer returned unto mine own bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: I behaved myself as though he had been my friend or brother; I bowed down in heaviness, as one that mourneth for his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: But in mine adversity they rejoiced and gathered themselves together; yea, the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they tore at me and ceased not.
speaker: Narrator

text: With hypocritical mockers at feasts they gnashed their teeth against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how long wilt Thou look on? Rescue my soul from their destructions, my precious soul from the lions.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give Thee thanks in the great congregation; I will praise Thee among many people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me; neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they speak not peace, but they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, they opened their mouths wide against me and said, “Aha, aha! Our eyes have seen it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This Thou hast seen, O Lord; keep not silence; O Lord, be not far from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stir up Thyself, and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me, O Lord my God, according to Thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them not say in their hearts, “Ah, so would we have it!” Let them not say, “We have swallowed him up.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at my hurt; let them be clothed with shame and dishonor that magnify themselves against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them shout for joy and be glad that favor my righteous cause; yea, let them say continually, “Let the Lord be magnified who hath pleasure in the prosperity of His servant.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And my tongue shall speak of Thy righteousness and of Thy praise all the day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart that there is no fear of God before his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes until his iniquity be found to be hateful.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit; he hath ceased to be wise and to do good.
speaker: Narrator

text: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy mercy, O Lord, is in the heavens, and Thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy righteousness is like the great mountains; Thy judgments are a great deep; O Lord, Thou preservest man and beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: How excellent is Thy lovingkindness, O God! Therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of Thy wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the bounty of Thy house, and Thou shalt make them drink of the river of Thy pleasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: For with Thee is the fountain of life; in Thy light shall we see light.
speaker: Narrator

text: O continue Thy lovingkindness unto them that know Thee, and Thy righteousness to the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.
speaker: Narrator

text: There the workers of iniquity lie fallen; they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fret not thyself because of evildoers, neither be thou envious against the workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the green herb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust in the Lord and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Delight thyself also in the Lord, and He shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in Him, and He shall bring it to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rest in the Lord and wait patiently for Him; fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cease from anger and forsake wrath; fret not thyself in any wise to do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For evildoers shall be cut off; but those that wait upon the Lord, they shall inherit the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For yet a little while and the wicked shall not be; yea, thou shalt diligently look for his place, and it shall not be.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the meek shall inherit the earth, and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked plotteth against the just, and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall laugh at him, for He seeth that his day is coming.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked have drawn out the sword and have bent their bows to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be of upright manner of living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: A little that a righteous man hath is better than the riches of many wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken, but the Lord upholdeth the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord knoweth the days of the upright; and their inheritance shall be for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time, and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the Lord shall be as the fat of lambs: they shall be consumed; into smoke shall they be consumed away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked borroweth and payeth not back, but the righteous showeth mercy and giveth:
speaker: Narrator

text: for such as are blessed by Him shall inherit the earth, but they that are cursed by Him shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The steps of a good man are ordered by the Lord, and He delighteth in his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down; for the Lord upholdeth him with His hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been young, and now am old; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging for bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is ever merciful and lendeth; and his seed is blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart from evil and do good, and dwell for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord loveth judgment, and forsaketh not His saints; they are preserved for ever, but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom, and his tongue talketh of judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law of his God is in his heart; none of his steps shall slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wait on the Lord and keep His way, and He shall exalt thee to inherit the land; when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a green bay tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he passed away, and lo, he was no more; yea, I sought him, but he could not be found.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mark the perfect man and behold the upright, for the end of that man is peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the transgressors shall be destroyed together; the end of the wicked shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the salvation of the righteous is in the Lord; He is their strength in the time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall help them and deliver them; He shall deliver them from the wicked and save them, because they trust in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, rebuke me not in Thy wrath, neither chasten me in Thy hot displeasure!
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thine arrows stick fast in me, and Thy hand presseth me sorely.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no soundness in my flesh, because of Thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones, because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mine iniquities have gone over mine head; as a heavy burden, they are too heavy for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My wounds are foul and corrupt because of my foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am troubled, I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my loins are filled with a loathsome disease, and there is no soundness in my flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am feeble and sorely broken; I have groaned because of the disquiet of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, all my desires are known to Thee; and my groaning is not hidden from Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart panteth, my strength faileth me; as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My loved ones and my friends stand aloof from my sore, and my kinsmen stand afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also that seek after my life lay snares for me; and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and devise deceits all the day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I was as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I was as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in Thee, O Lord, do I hope; Thou wilt hear, O Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I said, “Hear me, lest otherwise they should rejoice over me; when my foot slippeth, they magnify themselves against me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am ready for halting, and my sorrow is continually before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: But mine enemies are alive and they are strong; and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also that render evil for good are mine adversaries, because I follow the thing that is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forsake me not, O Lord; O my God, be not far from me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Make haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation!
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, “I will take heed of my ways, that I sin not with my tongue; I will keep my mouth with a bridle while the wicked is before me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I was dumb with silence; I held my peace, even from good, and my sorrow was stirred.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart was hot within me; while I was musing, the fire burned. Then I spoke with my tongue:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is, that I may know how frail I am.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, Thou hast made my days as a handbreadth, and mine age is as nothing before Thee; verily every man in his best state is altogether vanity. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: “Surely every man walketh in a vain show; surely they are disquieted in vain; he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And now, Lord, for what do I wait? My hope is in Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from all my transgressions; make me not the reproach of the foolish.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth, because Thou didst it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove Thy stroke away from me; I am consumed by the blow of Thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When with rebukes Thou dost correct man for iniquity, Thou makest his beauty to be consumed away like a moth; surely every man is vanity. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: “Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear unto my cry; hold not Thy peace at my tears; for I am a stranger with Thee and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
speaker: Narrator

text: O spare me, that I may recover strength before I go hence and am no more.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I waited patiently for the Lord; and He inclined unto me and heard my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me up also out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock and established my goings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He hath put a new song in my mouth; even praise unto our God; many shall see it and fear, and shall trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is that man that maketh the Lord his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many, O Lord my God, are Thy wonderful works which Thou hast done; and Thy thoughts which are directed toward us, they cannot be reckoned up in order unto Thee. If I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sacrifice and offering Thou didst not desire; mine ears hast Thou opened; burnt offering and sin offering hast Thou not required.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said I, “Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me:
speaker: Narrator

text: I delight to do Thy will, O my God; yea, Thy law is within my heart.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation; lo, I have not restrained my lips, O Lord, Thou knowest.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not hid Thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared Thy faithfulness and Thy salvation; I have not concealed Thy lovingkindness and Thy truth from the great congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Withhold not Thou Thy tender mercies from me, O Lord; let Thy lovingkindness and Thy truth continually preserve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For innumerable evils have compassed me about; mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up. They are more than the hairs of mine head; therefore my heart faileth me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me; O Lord, make haste to help me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be desolate as a reward for their shame, that say unto me, “Aha, aha!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all those that seek Thee rejoice and be glad in Thee; let those that love Thy salvation say continually, “The Lord be magnified!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh of me. Thou art my help and my deliverer; do not tarry, O my God!
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is he that considereth the poor; the Lord will deliver him in time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will preserve him and keep him alive, and he shallbe blessed upon the earth; and Thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing; Thou wilt turn him on his bed in his sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, “Lord, be merciful unto me; heal my soul, for I have sinned against Thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine enemies speak evil of me and say, “When shall he die and his name perish?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity; his heart gathereth iniquity to itself, and when he goeth out, he telleth it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that hate me whisper together against me; against me do they devise my hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: “An evil disease,” they say, “cleaveth fast unto him, and now that he lieth down, he shall rise up no more.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, mine own familiar friend in whom I trusted, that ate of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou, O Lord, be merciful unto me, and raise me up that I may requite them.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this I know that Thou favorest me: because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for me, Thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before Thy face for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting! Amen and Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the hart panteth for the water brooks, so panteth my soul for Thee, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God; when shall I come and appear before God?
speaker: Narrator

text: My tears have been my meat day and night, while they continually say unto me, “Where is thy God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When I remember these things, I pour out my soul within me, for I had gone with the multitude; I went with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with a multitude that kept holyday.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? And why art thou disquieted within me? Hope thou in God, for I shall yet praise Him for the help of His countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, my soul is cast down within me; therefore will I remember Thee from the land of Jordan and of the Hermonites, from the hill of Mizar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of Thy waterspouts; all Thy waves and Thy billows have gone over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the Lord will command His lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night His song shall be with me and my prayer unto the God of my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say unto God my rock, “Why hast Thou forgotten me? Why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?”
speaker: Narrator

text: As with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach me, while they say daily unto me, “Where is thy God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? And why art thou disquieted within me? Hope thou in God, for I shall yet praise Him, who is the health of my countenance and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation; O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou art the God of my strength; why dost Thou cast me off? Why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
speaker: Narrator

text: O send out Thy light and Thy truth! Let them lead me. Let them bring me unto Thy holy hill and to Thy tabernacles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto God my exceeding joy; yea, upon the harp will I praise Thee, O God, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? And why art thou disquieted within me? Hope in God, for I shall yet praise Him, who is the health of my countenance and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us what work Thou didst in their days, in the times of old:
speaker: Narrator

text: how Thou didst drive out the heathen with Thy hand, and planted them; how Thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them, but by Thy right hand and Thine arm and the light of Thy countenance, because Thou hadst favor unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my King, O God; command deliverances for Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through Thee will we push down our enemies; through Thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me;
speaker: Narrator

text: but Thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God we boast all the day long, and praise Thy name for ever. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou hast cast us off and put us to shame, and goest not forth with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy, and they that hate us despoil us for themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast given us up like sheep appointed for slaughter, and hast scattered us among the heathen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou sellest Thy people for nought, and dost not increase Thy wealth by their price.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbors, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth by reason of the enemy and avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text: All this has come upon us; yet have we not forgotten Thee, neither have we dealt falsely in Thy covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our heart has not turned back, neither have our steps turned from Thy way,
speaker: Narrator
