text: though Thou hast sorely broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we had forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god,
speaker: Narrator

text: shall not God search this out? For He knoweth the secrets of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, for Thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake! Why sleepest Thou, O Lord? Arise! Cast us not off for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why hidest Thou Thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?
speaker: Narrator

text: For our soul is bowed down to the dust; our belly cleaveth unto the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise for our help, and redeem us for Thy mercies’ sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart is composing a goodly matter; I speak of the verses which I have made concerning the King; my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art fairer than the children of men; grace is poured into Thy lips; therefore God hath blessed Thee for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gird Thy sword upon Thy thigh, O most Mighty, with Thy glory and Thy majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in Thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and Thy right hand shall teach Thee fearsome things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine arrows are sharp in the heart of the King’s enemies, whereby the people fall under Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever; the scepter of Thy Kingdom is a righteous scepter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou lovest righteousness and hatest wickedness; therefore God, Thy God, hath anointed Thee with the oil of gladness above Thy fellows.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Thy garments smell of myrrh and aloes and cassia, out of the ivory palaces whereby they have made Thee glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kings’ daughters were among Thy honorable women; at Thy right hand stood the queen in gold of Ophir.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken, O daughter, and consider and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people and thy father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall the King greatly desire thy beauty, for He is thy Lord; worship thou Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall entreat thy favor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The King’s daughter is all glorious within; her clothing is of wrought gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: She shall be brought unto the King in raiment of needlework; the virgins, her companions that follow her, shall be brought unto Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought; they shall enter into the King’s palace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead of Thy fathers shall be Thy children, whom Thou mayest make princes in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make Thy name to be remembered in all generations; therefore shall the people praise Thee for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore will we not fear though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: though the waters thereof roar and be troubled, though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: For God is the King of all the earth; sing ye praises with understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: God reigneth over the heathen; God sitteth upon the throne of His holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham. For the shields of the earth belong unto God; He is greatly exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is the Lord and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, on the mountain of His holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beautiful in situation, the joy of the whole earth is Mount Zion; on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is known in her palaces as a refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, the kings were assembled, they passed by together.
speaker: Narrator

text: They saw it and so they marveled; they were troubled and hastened away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear took hold upon them there, and pain as of a woman in travail;
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish with an east wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it for ever. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: We have thought of Thy lovingkindness, O God, in the midst of Thy temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to Thy name, O God, so is Thy praise unto the ends of the earth; Thy right hand is full of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Mount Zion rejoice! Let the daughters of Judah be glad because of Thy judgments!
speaker: Narrator

text: Walk about Zion and go round about her, count the towers thereof;
speaker: Narrator

text: mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces, that ye may tell it to the generation that follows.

text: For this God is our God for ever and ever; He will be our guide even unto death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: both low and high, rich and poor together.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth shall speak of wisdom, and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will incline mine ear to a parable; I will open my dark saying upon the harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity at my heels shall compass me about?
speaker: Narrator

text: They that trust in their wealth and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches,
speaker: Narrator

text: none of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him
speaker: Narrator

text: (for the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever),
speaker: Narrator

text: that they should still live for ever, and not see corruption.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he seeth that wise men die; likewise the fool and the brutish person perish and leave their wealth to others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their inward thought is that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless man, though he be in honor, abideth not; he is like the beasts that perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: This their way is their folly, yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them, and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning, and their beauty shall be consumed in the grave away from their dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave, for He shall receive me. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away; his glory shall not descend after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though while he lived he blessed his soul (and men will praise thee when thou doest well for thyself),
speaker: Narrator

text: he shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man, though he is in honor but understandeth not, is like the beasts that perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Mighty God, even the Lord, hath spoken and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.

text: Our God shall come and shall not keep silence; a devouring fire shall go before Him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall call to the heavens from above and to the earth, that He may judge His people:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Gather My saints together unto Me, those that have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the heavens shall declare His righteousness, for God Himself is judge. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: “Hear, O My people, and I will speak, O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I am God, even thy God.

text: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt offerings, to have been continually before Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor hegoats out of thy folds.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every beast of the forest is Mine and the cattle upon a thousand hills.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know all the fowls of the mountains, and the wild beasts of the field are Mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I were hungry I would not tell thee, for the world is Mine and the fullness thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
speaker: Narrator

text: “Offer unto God thanksgiving, and pay thy vows unto the Most High,
speaker: Narrator

text: and call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto the wicked God saith: “What hast thou to do to declare My statutes, or that thou shouldest take My covenant in thy mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: seeing thou hatest instruction and castest My words behind thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consented with him, and thou hast been partaker with adulterers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother’s son.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether such a one as thyself. But I will reprove thee and set them in order before thine eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces and there be none to deliver:
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso offereth praise glorifieth Me; and to him that ordereth his manner of living aright, I will show the salvation of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to Thy lovingkindness; according unto the multitude of Thy tender mercies, blot out my transgressions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wash me thoroughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I acknowledge my transgressions, and my sin is ever before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Against Thee, Thee only, have I sinned and done this evil in Thy sight, that Thou mightest be justified when Thou speakest, and be clear when Thou judgest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I was shaped in iniquity, and in sin did my mother conceive me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, Thou desirest truth in my inward parts; in the hidden part Thou shalt make me to know wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make me to hear joy and gladness, that the bones which Thou hast broken may rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide Thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Do good in Thy good pleasure unto Zion; build Thou the walls of Jerusalem.

text: Thou lovest all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.

text: “Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength, but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his own wickedness.”

text: Every one of them has turned back; they have altogether become filthy; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

text: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge—those who eat up my people as they eat bread? They have not called upon God.

text: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies; cut them off in Thy truth.

text: Give ear to my prayer, O God, and hide not Thyself from my supplication.

text: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.”

speaker: Narrator

text: In God will I praise His word; in the Lord will I praise His word.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God have I put my trust; I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.

speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God; defend me from them that rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.

text: For lo, they lie in wait for my soul; the mighty are gathered against me, not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They run and prepare themselves though I am not at fault. Awake to help me, and behold!

text: Thou therefore, O Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen; be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: They return at evening; they make a noise like a dog and go round about the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, they belch out with their mouth; swords are in their lips; “For who,” say they, “doth hear?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou, O Lord, shalt laugh at them; Thou shalt hold all the heathen in derision.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of his strength, I will wait upon Thee; for God is my defense.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of my mercy shall go before me; God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slay them not, lest my people forget; scatter them by Thy power and bring them down, O Lord our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips, let them even be taken in their pride, and for the cursing and lying which they speak.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Let them wander up and down for meat, and grumble if they be not satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will sing of Thy power, yea, I will sing aloud of Thy mercy in the morning; for Thou hast been my defense and refuge in the day of my trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Thee, O my Strength, will I sing; for God is my defense, and the God of my mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, Thou hast cast us off, Thou hast scattered us, Thou hast been displeased; O, turn Thyself to us again!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made the earth to tremble, Thou hast broken it; heal the breaches thereof, for it shaketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast shown Thy people hard things; Thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear Thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah

text: That Thy beloved may be delivered, save with Thy right hand and hear me!

speaker: Narrator

text: Give us help from trouble, for vain is the help of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through God we shall do valiantly, for He it is that shall tread down our enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the end of the earth will I cry unto Thee when my heart is overwhelmed; lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

text: For Thou hast been a shelter for me and a strong tower from the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will abide in Thy tabernacle for ever; I will trust in the refuge of Thy wings. Selah

text: He shall abide before God for ever; O prepare mercy and truth, that they may preserve him.

text: He alone is my rock and my salvation; He is my defense; I shall not be greatly moved.

text: How long will ye conjure mischief against a man? Ye shall be slain, all of you; as a bulging wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.
speaker: Narrator

text: They consult only to cast him down from his excellency, they delight in lies, they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul, wait thou only upon God, for my expectation is from Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He only is my rock and my salvation; He is my defense; I shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God is my salvation and my glory; the rock of my strength and my refuge is in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust in Him at all times, ye people; pour out your heart before Him; God is a refuge for us. Selah

text: Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie; if weighed in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.

text: Trust not in oppression, and put not vain hope in robbery; if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

text: O God, Thou art my God; early will I seek Thee. My soul thirsteth for Thee, my flesh longeth for Thee, in a dry and thirsty land where no water is,
speaker: Narrator

text: to see Thy power and Thy glory as I have seen Thee in the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because Thy lovingkindness is better than life, my lips shall praise Thee.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness and my mouth shall praise Thee with joyful lips,

text: when I remember Thee upon my bed, and meditate on Thee in the night watches.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because Thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of Thy wings will I rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul followeth hard after Thee; Thy right hand upholdeth me.

text: Wilt Thou show wonders to the dead? Shall the dead arise and praise Thee? Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall Thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave? Or Thy faithfulness in destruction?
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall Thy wonders be known in the dark? And Thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto Thee have I cried, O Lord, and in the morning shall my prayer come before Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, why castest Thou off my soul? Why hidest Thou Thy face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up; while I suffer Thy terrors I am distraught.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy fierce wrath goeth over me; Thy terrors have cut me off.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came round about me daily like water; they compassed me about together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lover and friend hast Thou put far from me, and mine acquaintances into darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing of the mercies of the Lord for ever; with my mouth will I make known Thy faithfulness to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have said, “Mercy shall be built up for ever; Thy faithfulness shalt Thou establish in the very heavens.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have made a covenant with My chosen, I have sworn unto David My servant:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thy Seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations.’” Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: And the heavens shall praise Thy wonders, O Lord, Thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the Lord? Who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be held in reverence by all them that are about Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God of hosts, who is a strong Lord like unto Thee? Or to Thy faithfulness round about Thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou rulest the raging of the sea; when the waves thereof arise, Thou stillest them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; Thou hast scattered Thine enemies with Thy strong arm.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens are Thine, the earth also is Thine; as for the world and the fullness thereof, Thou hast founded them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The north and the south, Thou hast created them; Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast a mighty arm; strong is Thy hand, and high is Thy right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Justice and judgment are the habitation of Thy throne; mercy and truth shall go before Thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound! They shall walk, O Lord, in the light of Thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Thy name shall they rejoice all the day, and in Thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou art the glory of their strength, and in Thy favor our horn shall be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is our defense, and the Holy One of Israel is our King.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Thou didst speak in a vision to Thy holy one and said, “I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have found David My servant; with My holy oil have I anointed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: With him My hand shall be established; Mine arm shall also strengthen him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The enemy shall not exact from him, nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But My faithfulness and My mercy shall be with him, and in My name shall his horn be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set his hand also over the sea, and his right hand over the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall cry unto Me, ‘Thou art my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I will make him My firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and My covenant shall stand fast with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: His Seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: If his children forsake My law and walk not in My judgments,
speaker: Narrator

text: if they break My statutes and keep not My commandments,
speaker: Narrator

text: then will I visit their transgression with the rod and their iniquity with stripes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless My lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor permit My faithfulness to fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the things which have gone out of My lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once have I sworn by My holiness that I will not lie unto David.
speaker: Narrator

text: His Seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in the heaven.” Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou hast cast off and abhorred; Thou hast been wroth with Thine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made void the covenant of Thy servant; Thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; Thou hast brought his strongholds to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that pass by the way despoil him; he is a reproach to his neighbors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; Thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: The days of his youth hast Thou shortened, Thou hast covered him with shame. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: How long, Lord? Wilt Thou hide Thyself for ever? Shall Thy wrath burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember how short my time is; why hast Thou made all men in vain?
speaker: Narrator

text: What man is he that liveth and shall not see death? Shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, where are Thy former lovingkindnesses, which Thou hast sworn unto David in Thy truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, Lord, the reproach against Thy servants” how I bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people
speaker: Narrator

text: wherewith Thine enemies have reproached, O Lord, wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of Thine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord for evermore! Amen and Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, Thou hast been our dwelling place in all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever Thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, Thou art God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou turnest man to destruction, and sayest, “Return, ye children of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For a thousand years in Thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep: in the morning they are like grass which groweth up;
speaker: Narrator

text: in the morning it flourisheth and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down and withereth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are consumed by Thine anger, and by Thy wrath are we troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set our iniquities before Thee, our secret sins in the light of Thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all our days are passed away in Thy wrath; we spend our years as a tale that is told.
speaker: Narrator

text: The days of our years are threescore years and ten; and if by reason of strength they be fourscore years, yet is their strength labor and sorrow; for it is soon cut off and we fly away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who knoweth the power of Thine anger? Even according to the fear of Thee, so is Thy wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: So teach us to number our days, that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return, O Lord! How long? And let Thee repent concerning Thy servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: O satisfy us early with Thy mercy, that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make us glad according to the days wherein Thou hast afflicted us, and the years wherein we have seen evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Thy work appear unto Thy servants, and Thy glory unto their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us, and establish Thou the work of our hands for us—yea, the work of our hands, establish Thou it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say of the Lord, “He is my refuge and my fortress; my God, in Him will I trust.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely He shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler and from the noisome pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall cover thee with His feathers, and under His wings shalt thou trust; His truth shall be thy shield and buckler.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not be afraid of the terror by night, nor of the arrow that flieth by day,
speaker: Narrator

text: nor of the pestilence that walketh in darkness, nor of the destruction that layeth waste at noonday.
speaker: Narrator

text: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand, but it shall not come nigh thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou hast made the Lord, who is my refuge, even the Most High, thy habitation,
speaker: Narrator

text: there shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He shall give His angels charge over thee to keep thee in all thy ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder; the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample underfoot.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Because he hath set his love upon Me, therefore will I deliver him; I will set him on high, because he hath known My name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him.
speaker: Narrator

text: With long life will I satisfy him, and show him My salvation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the Lord, and to sing praises unto Thy name, O Most High,
speaker: Narrator

text: to show forth Thy lovingkindness in the morning, and Thy faithfulness every night,
speaker: Narrator

text: upon an instrument of ten strings and upon the psaltery, upon the harp with a solemn sound.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou, Lord, hast made me glad through Thy work; I will triumph in the works of Thy hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, how great are Thy works! And Thy thoughts are very deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: A brutish man knoweth not, neither doth a fool understand this:
speaker: Narrator

text: when the wicked spring up as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish, it is that they shall be destroyed for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: but Thou, Lord, art Most High for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, Thine enemies, O Lord, for lo, Thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text: But my horn shalt Thou exalt like the horn of a unicorn; I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eye also shall see what I desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear what I desire upon the wicked that rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree; he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that are planted in the house of the Lord shall flourish in the courts of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing to show
speaker: Narrator

text: that the Lord is upright. He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord reigneth; He is clothed with majesty. The Lord is clothed with strength, wherewith He hath girded Himself. The world also is established, that it cannot be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy throne is established of old; Thou art from everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The floods have lifted up, O Lord, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their waves.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord on high is mightier than the noise of many waters, yea, than the mighty waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy testimonies are very sure; holiness becometh Thine house, O Lord, for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God, to whom vengeance belongeth—O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, show Thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up Thyself, Thou judge of the earth; render to the proud their due reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?
speaker: Narrator

text: How long shall they utter and speak hard things, and all the workers of iniquity boast?
speaker: Narrator

text: They break in pieces Thy people, O Lord, and afflict Thine heritage.
speaker: Narrator

text: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they say, “The Lord shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand, ye brutish among the people; and ye fools, when will ye be wise?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that planted the ear, shall He not hear? He that formed the eye, shall He not see?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not He correct? He that teacheth man knowledge, shall not He know?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man whom Thou chastenest, O Lord, and teachest him out of Thy law,
speaker: Narrator

text: that Thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be dug for the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord will not cast off His people, neither will He forsake His inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: But judgment shall return unto righteousness, and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? Or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
speaker: Narrator

text: Unless the Lord had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I said, “My foot slippeth,” Thy mercy, O Lord, held me up.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the multitude of my thoughts within me, Thy comforts delight my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with Thee, which frameth mischief by a law?
speaker: Narrator

text: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord is my defense, and my God is the rock of my refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the Lord our God shall cut them off!
speaker: Narrator

text: O come, let us sing unto the Lord! Let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving, and make a joyful noise unto Him with psalms.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: In His hand are the deep places of the earth; the strength of the hills is His also.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sea is His, and He made it; and His hands formed the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: O come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before the Lord our Maker.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He is our God, and we are the people of His pasture and the sheep of His hand. Today, if ye will hear His voice:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Harden not your heart as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness
speaker: Narrator

text: when your fathers tempted Me, proved Me, and saw My work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said ‘It is a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known My ways.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto them I swore in My wrath, that they should not enter into My rest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O sing unto the Lord a new song; sing unto the Lord, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord, bless His name; show forth His salvation from day to day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare His glory among the heathen, His wonders among all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is great and greatly to be praised; He is to be feared above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the gods of the nations are idols, but the Lord made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor and majesty are before Him; strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the Lord, O ye kindreds of the people; give unto the Lord glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the Lord the glory due unto His name; bring an offering, and come into His courts.
speaker: Narrator

text: O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness; fear before Him, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say among the heathen that the Lord reigneth; the world also shall be established, that it shall not be moved; He shall judge the people righteously.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and the fullness thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the field be joyful, and all that is therein; then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice
speaker: Narrator

text: before the Lord. For He cometh, for He cometh to judge the earth; He shall judge the world with righteousness, and the people with His truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord reigneth, let the earth rejoice! Let the multitude of isles be glad thereof!
speaker: Narrator

text: Clouds and darkness are round about Him; righteousness and judgment are the habitation of His throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fire goeth before Him, and burneth up His enemies round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: His lightnings enlightened the world; the earth saw and trembled.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens declare His righteousness, and all the people see His glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Confounded be all they that serve graven images, that boast themselves of idols. Worship Him, all ye gods!
speaker: Narrator

text: Zion heard and was glad, and the daughters of Judah rejoiced because of Thy judgments, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou, Lord, art high above all the earth; Thou art exalted far above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that love the Lord, hate evil! He preserveth the souls of His saints; He delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the Lord, ye righteous, and give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: O sing unto the Lord a new song, for He hath done marvelous things! His right hand and His holy arm hath gotten Him the victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath made known His salvation; His righteousness hath He openly shown in the sight of the heathen.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath remembered His mercy and His truth toward the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make a joyful noise unto the Lord, all the earth! Make a loud noise, and rejoice, and sing praise!
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord with the harp, with the harp and the voice of a psalm.
speaker: Narrator

text: With trumpets and sound of cornet make a joyful noise before the Lord, the King!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sea roar and the fullness thereof, the world and they that dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the floods clap their hands, let the hills be joyful together
speaker: Narrator

text: before the Lord. For He cometh to judge the earth; with righteousness shall He judge the world, and the people with equity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord reigneth; let the people tremble! He sitteth between the cherubims; let the earth be moved!
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is great in Zion, and He is high above all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise Thy great and fearsome name, for it is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The King’s strength also loveth judgment; Thou dost establish equity; Thou executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt ye the Lord our God, and worship at His footstool, for He is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron are among His priests, and Samuel among them that call upon His name; they called upon the Lord, and He answered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke unto them in the cloudy pillar; they kept His testimonies and the ordinance that He gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst answer them, O Lord our God; Thou wast a God that forgavest them, though Thou took vengeance on their inventions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt the Lord our God, and worship at His holy hill; for the Lord our God is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make a joyful noise unto the Lord, all ye lands!
speaker: Narrator

text: Serve the Lord with gladness; come before His presence with singing!
speaker: Narrator

text: Know ye that the Lord, He is God; it is He that hath made us, and not we ourselves. We are His people, and the sheep of His pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text: Enter into His gates with thanksgiving, and into His courts with praise! Be thankful unto Him, and bless His name!
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is good, His mercy is everlasting; and His truth endureth to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing of mercy and judgment; unto Thee, O Lord, will I sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. O when wilt Thou come unto me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes; I hate the work of them that turn aside; it shall not cleave to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: A froward heart shall depart from me; I will not know a wicked person.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbor, him will I cut off; him that hath a haughty look and a proud heart will I not suffer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me; he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house; he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will early destroy all the wicked of the land, that I may cut off all wicked doers from the city of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and let my cry come unto Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide not Thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline Thine ear unto me. In the day when I call, answer me speedily.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as a hearth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart is smitten and withered like grass, so that I forget to eat my bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: By reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am like a pelican of the wilderness; I am like an owl of the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the housetop.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine enemies reproach me all the day, and them that are mad against me are sworn against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have eaten ashes like bread and mingled my drink with weeping,
speaker: Narrator

text: because of Thine indignation and Thy wrath; for Thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.
speaker: Narrator

text: My days are like a shadow that declineth, and I am withered like grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou, O Lord, shalt endure for ever, and Thy remembrance unto all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt arise and have mercy upon Zion; for the time to favor her, yea, the set time has come.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favor the dust thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the heathen shall fear the name of the Lord, and all the kings of the earth Thy glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord shall build up Zion, He shall appear in His glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be written for the generation to come, and the people which shall be created shall praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath looked down from the height of His sanctuary; from heaven did the Lord behold the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: to hear the groaning of the prisoner, to loose those that are appointed to death,
speaker: Narrator

text: to declare the name of the Lord in Zion, and His praise in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: when people are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: He weakened my strength on the way; He shortened my days.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, “O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days; Thy years are throughout all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of old hast Thou laid the foundation of the earth, and the heavens are the work of Thy hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall perish, but Thou shalt endure; yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; and as a vesture shalt Thou change them, and they shall be changed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou art the same, and Thy years shall have no end.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before Thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the Lord, O my soul; and all that is within me, bless His holy name!
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the Lord, O my soul, and forget not all His benefits—
speaker: Narrator

text: who forgiveth all thine iniquities, who healeth all thy diseases,
speaker: Narrator

text: who redeemeth thy life from destruction, who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies,
speaker: Narrator

text: who satisfieth thy mouth with good things, so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made known His ways unto Moses, His acts unto the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is merciful and gracious, slow to anger and plenteous in mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not always chide, neither will He keep His anger for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath not dealt with us according to our sins, nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the heaven is high above the earth, so great is His mercy toward them that fear Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath He removed our transgressions from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a father pitieth his children, so the Lord pitieth them that fear Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He knoweth our frame; He remembereth that we are dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for man, his days are as grass; as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the mercy of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear Him, and His righteousness unto children’s children,
speaker: Narrator

text: to such as keep His covenant, and to those that remember His commandments to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath prepared His throne in the heavens, and His Kingdom ruleth over all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the Lord, ye His angels that excel in strength, that do His commandments, hearkening unto the voice of His word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless ye the Lord, all ye His hosts, ye ministers of His, that do His pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the Lord, all His works, in all places of His dominion. Bless the Lord, O my soul!
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the Lord, O my soul! O Lord my God, Thou art very great; Thou art clothed with honor and majesty—
speaker: Narrator

text: who coverest Thyself with light as with a garment, who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain;
speaker: Narrator

text: who layeth the beams of His chambers in the waters, who maketh the clouds His chariot, who walketh upon the wings of the wind;
speaker: Narrator

text: who maketh His angels spirits, His ministers a flaming fire;
speaker: Narrator

text: who laid the foundations of the earth, that it should never be removed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou covered it with the deep as with a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: At Thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of Thy thunder they hastened away.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go up by the mountains; they go down by the valleys unto the place which Thou hast founded for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set a boundary that they may not pass over, that they turn not again to cover the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth the springs into the valleys, which run among the hills.
speaker: Narrator

text: They give drink to every beast of the field; the wild asses quench their thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: By them shall the fowls of the heavens have their habitation, which sing among the branches.
speaker: Narrator

text: He watereth the hills from His chambers; the earth is satisfied with the fruit of Thy works.
speaker: Narrator

text: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle and herbs for the service of man, that he may bring forth food out of the earth,

text: and wine that maketh glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face to shine, and bread which strengtheneth man’s heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The trees of the Lord are full of sap, the cedars of Lebanon which He hath planted,

text: where the birds make their nests; as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.

text: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats, and the rocks for the conies.
speaker: Narrator

text: He appointed the moon for seasons; the sun knoweth his time to go down.

text: Thou makest darkness, and it is night, wherein all the beasts of the forest creep forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young lions roar after their prey and seek their meat from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the sun ariseth, they gather themselves together and lay them down in their dens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man goeth forth unto his work and to his labor until the evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, how manifold are Thy works! In wisdom hast Thou made them all; the earth is full of Thy riches.

text: So also is this great and wide sea, wherein are innumerable creeping things, both small and great beasts.

text: There go the ships; there also is that leviathan, whom Thou hast made to play therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: These all wait upon Thee, that Thou mayest give them their meat in due season.
speaker: Narrator

text: What Thou givest them, they gather: Thou openest Thine hand, they are filled with good.

text: Thou hidest Thy face, they are troubled; Thou takest away their breath, they die and return to their dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou sendest forth Thy Spirit, they are created; and Thou renewest the face of the earth.

text: The glory of the Lord shall endure for ever; the Lord shall rejoice in His works.

text: He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth; He toucheth the hills, and they smoke.

text: I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live; I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
speaker: Narrator

text: My meditation of Him shall be sweet; I will be glad in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the Lord, O my soul! Praise ye the Lord!

text: O give thanks unto the Lord, call upon His name; make known His deeds among the people.

text: Sing unto Him, sing psalms unto Him; talk ye of all His wondrous works.

text: saying, “Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance,”

text: Until the time when his word came to pass, the word of the Lord tried him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king sent and loosed him, even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.

text: to command his princes at his pleasure and teach his elders wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel also came into Egypt, and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He increased His people greatly, and made them stronger than their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned their heart to hate His people and to deal subtly with His servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent Moses His servant, and Aaron whom He had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: They showed His signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent darkness and made it dark, and they rebelled not against His word.

text: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

text: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, even in the chambers of their kings.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke and there came divers sorts of flies and lice in all their borders.

text: He gave them hail for rain and flaming fire in their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: He smote their vines also and their fig trees, and broke the trees of their borders.

text: He spoke and the locusts came, and caterpillars without number,

text: and they ate up all the herbs in their land and devoured the fruit of their ground.

text: He spread a cloud for a covering and fire to give light in the night.

text: He opened the rock and the waters gushed out, and ran in the dry places like a river.

text: For He remembered His holy promise and Abraham His servant.

text: And He brought forth His people with joy, His chosen with gladness,

text: and gave them the lands of the heathen; and they inherited the labor of the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: that they might observe His statutes and keep His laws. Praise ye the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord! O give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good, for His mercy endureth for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can utter the mighty acts of the Lord? Who can show forth all His praise?
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are they that keep judgment and he that doeth righteousness at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember me, O Lord, with the favor which Thou bearest unto Thy people; O visit me with Thy salvation,

text: that I may see the good of Thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of Thy nation, that I may glory with Thine inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless He saved them for His name’s sake, that He might make His mighty power to be known.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

text: And the waters covered their enemies; there was not one of them left.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: and they served their idols, which were a snare unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own schemes.

text: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against His people, insomuch that He abhorred His own inheritance.

text: And He gave them into the hand of the heathen, and they that hated them ruled over them.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless He regarded their affliction when He heard their cry,
speaker: Narrator

text: and He remembered for them His covenant, and repented according to the multitude of His mercies.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made them also to be pitied by all those that carried them captive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto Thy holy name, and to triumph in Thy praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting, and let all the people say, “Amen.” Praise ye the Lord!

speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that men would praise the Lord for His goodness, and for His wonderful works to the children of men!

text: For He hath broken the gates of brass and cut the bars of iron asunder.

speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and He bringeth them out of their distresses.

text: They compassed me about also with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my love they are my adversaries, but I give myself unto prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set Thou a wicked man over him, and let Satan stand at his right hand.

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath, and let the strangers despoil his labor.

text: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him, neither let there be any to favor his fatherless children.

text: Let them be before the Lord continually, that He may cut off the memory of them from the earth;
