text: I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help!
speaker: Narrator

text: My help cometh from the Lord, who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not permit thy foot to be moved; He that keepeth thee will not slumber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, He that keepeth Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is thy keeper; the Lord is thy shade upon thy right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil; He shall preserve thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was glad when they said unto me, “Let us go into the house of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Our feet shall stand within thy gates, O Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerusalem is built as a city that is united together,
speaker: Narrator

text: whither the tribes go up, the tribes of the Lord, according to the testimony of Israel to give thanks unto the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: “They shall prosper that love thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peace be within thy walls and prosperity within thy palaces.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For my brethren and companions’ sakes I will now say, “Peace be within thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the house of the Lord our God, I will seek thy good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Thee I lift up mine eyes, O Thou that dwellest in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress, so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God until He has mercy upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us, for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If it had not been the Lord who was on our side”—now may Israel say—
speaker: Narrator

text: “if it had not been the Lord who was on our side when men rose up against us,
speaker: Narrator

text: then would they have swallowed us up alive when their wrath was kindled against us;
speaker: Narrator

text: then would the waters have overwhelmed us, the stream would have gone over our soul;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the proud waters would have gone over our soul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord, who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul has escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers; the snare is broken, and we have escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our help is in the name of the Lord, who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that trust in the Lord shall be as Mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but abideth for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the Lord is round about His people from henceforth, even for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the allotment of the righteous, lest the righteous put forth their hands to do iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do good, O Lord, unto those that are good and to them that are upright in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the Lord shall lead them away with the workers of iniquity; but peace shall be upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord returned the captives to Zion, we were like them that dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing. Then said they among the heathen, “The Lord hath done great things for them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath done great things for us, whereof we are glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn back our captivity, O Lord, as the streams in the South.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Except the Lord build the house, they labor in vain that build it. Except the Lord keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows; for so He giveth His beloved sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, children are a heritage of the Lord, and the fruit of the womb is His reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: As arrows are in the hand of a mighty man, so are the children of the youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them; they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies at the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is every one that feareth the Lord, that walketh in His ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou shalt eat the labor of thine hands; happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of thine house, thy children like olive plants round about thy table.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall bless thee out of Zion, and thou shalt see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, thou shalt see thy children’s children, and peace upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth”—may Israel now say—
speaker: Narrator

text: “many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, yet they have not prevailed against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The plowers plowed upon my back; they made long their furrows.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is righteous; He hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth before it groweth up,
speaker: Narrator

text: wherewith the mower filleth not his hand, nor he that bindeth sheaves, his bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither do those who go by say, “The blessing of the Lord be upon you; we bless you in the name of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the depths have I cried unto Thee, O Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, hear my voice! Let Thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text: If Thou, Lord, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: But there is forgiveness with Thee, that Thou mayest be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text: I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in His word do I hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning— I say, more than they that watch for the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel hope in the Lord, for with the Lord there is mercy, and with Him is plenteous redemption.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty; neither do I exercise myself with great matters, or in things too high for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely I have behaved and quieted myself as a child that is weaned from his mother; my soul is even as a weaned child.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel hope in the Lord from henceforth and for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, remember David and all his afflictions—
speaker: Narrator

text: how he swore unto the Lord and vowed unto the Mighty God of Jacob:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not give sleep to mine eyes or slumber to mine eyelids
speaker: Narrator

text: until I find out a place for the Lord, a habitation for the Mighty God of Jacob.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, we heard of it at Ephrathah; we found it in the fields of the wood:
speaker: Narrator

text: “We will go into His tabernacles; we will worship at His footstool.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Lord, into Thy rest, Thou and the ark of Thy strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Thy priests be clothed with righteousness, and let Thy saints shout for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thy servant David’s sake, turn not away the face of Thine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath sworn in truth unto David; He will not turn from it: “Of the fruit of thy body I will set upon thy throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thy children will keep My covenant and My testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hath chosen Zion; He hath desired it for His habitation:
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is My rest for ever; here will I dwell, for I have desired it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will abundantly bless her provision, I will satisfy her poor with bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: There will I make the horn of David to bud; I have ordained a lamp for Mine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: His enemies will I clothe with shame, but upon himself shall his crown flourish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like the precious ointment upon the head that ran down upon the beard, even Aaron’s beard that went down to the skirts of his garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is as the dew of Hermon, and as the dew that descended upon the mountains of Zion; for there the Lord commanded the blessing, even life for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, bless ye the Lord, all ye servants of the Lord, who by night stand in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord who made heaven and earth bless thee out of Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord, praise ye the name of the Lord! Praise Him, O ye servants of the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God,
speaker: Narrator

text: praise the Lord, for the Lord is good; sing praises unto His name, for it is pleasant.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hath chosen Jacob for Himself, and Israel for His peculiar treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that the Lord is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatsoever the Lord pleased, that did He in heaven and on earth, in the seas and in all deep places.
speaker: Narrator

text: He causeth the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; He maketh lightnings for the rain; He bringeth the wind out of His treasuries.
speaker: Narrator

text: He smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh and upon all his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: He smote great nations, and slew mighty kings:
speaker: Narrator

text: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan;
speaker: Narrator

text: and gave their land as a heritage, a heritage unto Israel His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy name, O Lord, endureth for ever, and Thy memorial, O Lord, throughout all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord will judge His people, and He will repent Himself concerning His servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;
speaker: Narrator

text: they have ears, but they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouths.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that make them are like unto them; so is every one that trusteth in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the Lord, O house of Israel! Bless the Lord, O house of Aaron!
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the Lord, O house of Levi! Ye that fear the Lord, bless the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord out of Zion, who dwelleth in Jerusalem! Praise ye the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good, for His mercy endureth for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the God of gods, for His mercy endureth for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks to the Lord of lords, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: to Him who alone doeth great wonders, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: to Him that by wisdom made the heavens, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: to Him that stretched out the earth above the waters, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: to Him that made great lights, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: the sun to rule by day, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: the moon and stars to rule by night, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: to Him that smote Egypt in their firstborn, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: and brought out Israel from among them, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: with a strong hand and with a stretched out arm, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: to Him who divided the Red Sea into parts, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: and made Israel to pass through the midst of it, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: but overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: to Him who led His people through the wilderness, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: to Him who smote great kings, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: and slew famous kings, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: Sihon king of the Amorites, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Og the king of Bashan, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: and gave their land as a heritage, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: even a heritage unto Israel His servant, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: who remembered us in our low estate, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: and hath redeemed us from our enemies, for His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: who giveth food to all flesh, for His mercy endureth for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the God of heaven, for His mercy endureth for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down; yea, we wept when we remembered Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: We hung our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song, and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, “Sing us one of the songs of Zion!”
speaker: Narrator

text: How shall we sing the Lord’s song in a strange land?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cleverness.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth, if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, O Lord, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem’s fall, who said, “Raze it, raze it, even to the foundation thereof!”
speaker: Narrator

text: O daughter of Babylon who art to be destroyed, happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise Thee with my whole heart; before the gods will I sing praise unto Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will worship toward Thy holy temple, and praise Thy name for Thy lovingkindness and for Thy truth, for Thou hast magnified Thy word above all Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day when I cried, Thou answered me, and strengthened me with strength in my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the kings of the earth shall praise Thee, O Lord, when they hear the words of Thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, they shall sing of the ways of the Lord, for great is the glory of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though the Lord be high, yet hath He respect unto the lowly, but the proud He knoweth afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, Thou wilt revive me; Thou shalt stretch forth Thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and Thy right hand shall save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will perfect that which concerneth me; Thy mercy, O Lord, endureth for ever; forsake not the works of Thine own hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, Thou hast searched me and known me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising; Thou understandest my thought afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is not a word on my tongue, but lo, O Lord, Thou knowest it altogether.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid Thine hand upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whither shall I go from Thy Spirit? Or whither shall I flee from Thy presence?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I ascend up into heaven, Thou art there; if I make my bed in hell, behold, Thou art there.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I take the wings of the morning and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: even there shall Thy hand lead me, and Thy right hand shall hold me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I say, “Surely the darkness shall cover me,” even the night shall be light about me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, the darkness hideth not from Thee, but the night shineth as the day; the darkness and the light are both alike to Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast possessed my reins. Thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise Thee, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; marvelous are Thy works, and that my soul knoweth right well.
speaker: Narrator

text: My substance was not hid from Thee when I was made in secret, and intricately wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being imperfect; and in Thy book all my members were written, which in continuity were fashioned, when as yet there were none of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: How precious also are Thy thoughts unto me, O God! How great is the sum of them!
speaker: Narrator

text: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand; when I awake, I am still with Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely, Thou wilt slay the wicked, O God. Depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they speak against Thee wickedly, and Thine enemies take Thy name in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do I not hate them, O Lord, that hate Thee? And am I not grieved with those that rise up against Thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate them with perfect hatred; I count them mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Search me, O God, and know my heart; try me, and know my thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me, O Lord, from the evil man; preserve me from the violent man,
speaker: Narrator

text: who imagine mischiefs in their heart; continually are they gathered together for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders’ poison is under their lips. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man, who has purposed to overthrow my goings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have hid a snare for me, and with cords they have spread a net by the wayside; they have set traps for me. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: I said unto the Lord, “Thou art my God; hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God the Lord, the strength of my salvation, Thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Grant not, O Lord, the desires of the wicked; further not his wicked device, lest they exalt themselves. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let burning coals fall upon them; let them be cast into the fire, into deep pits, that they rise not up again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not an evil speaker be established on the earth; evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that the Lord will maintain the cause of the afflicted and the right of the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto Thy name; the upright shall dwell in Thy presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, I cry unto Thee! Make haste unto me! Give ear unto my voice when I cry unto Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my prayer be set before Thee as incense, and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practice wicked works with men that work iniquity; and let me not eat of their dainties.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the righteous smite me: it shall be a kindness. And let him reprove me: it shall be as an excellent oil, which shall not break my head; for yet my prayer shall be with them in their calamities.
speaker: Narrator

text: When their judges are overthrown onto stony places, they shall hear my words, for they are sweet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our bones are scattered at the grave’s mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But mine eyes are unto Thee, O God the Lord; in Thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me from the snares which they have laid for me, and the traps of the workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst I thereupon escape.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried unto the Lord with my voice; with my voice unto the Lord did I make my supplication.
speaker: Narrator

text: I poured out my complaint before Him; I laid before Him my trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then Thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I looked on my right hand and beheld, but there was no man that would know me. Refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried unto Thee, O Lord; I said, “Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Attend unto my cry, for I am brought very low; deliver me from my persecutors, for they are stronger than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise Thy name; the righteous shall compass me about, for Thou shalt deal bountifully with me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O Lord, give ear to my supplications; in Thy faithfulness answer me, and in Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And enter not into judgment with Thy servant, for in Thy sight shall no man living be justified.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground. He hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all Thy works; I muse on the work of Thy hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: I stretch forth my hands unto Thee; my soul thirsteth after Thee, as a thirsty land. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me speedily, O Lord; my spirit faileth. Hide not Thy face from me, lest I be like them that go down into the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause me to hear Thy lovingkindness in the morning, for in Thee do I trust. Cause me to know the way wherein I should walk, for I lift up my soul unto Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me, O Lord, from mine enemies; I flee unto Thee to hide me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me to do Thy will, for Thou art my God. Thy Spirit is good; lead me into the land of uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Quicken me, O Lord, for Thy name’s sake; for Thy righteousness’ sake bring my soul out of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in Thy mercy cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them that afflict my soul; for I am Thy servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord my strength, who teacheth my hands to war and my fingers to fight;
speaker: Narrator

text: my goodness and my fortress, my high tower and my deliverer, my shield and He in whom I trust, who subdueth my people under me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, what is man that Thou takest notice of him? Or the son of man that Thou makest account of him?
speaker: Narrator

text: Man is like vanity; his days are as a shadow that passeth away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bow Thy heavens, O Lord, and come down; touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast forth lightning and scatter them; shoot out Thine arrows and destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send Thine hand from above; rescue me and deliver me out of great waters from the hand of strangers,
speaker: Narrator

text: whose mouth speaketh vanity and whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing a new song unto Thee, O God; upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is He that giveth salvation unto kings, who delivereth David His servant from the hurtful sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rescue me and deliver me from the hand of strangers, whose mouth speaketh vanity and whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood,
speaker: Narrator

text: that our sons may be as plants full grown in their youth, that our daughters may be as cornerstones, polished after the similitude of a palace;
speaker: Narrator

text: that our garners may be full, affording all manner of store, that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets;
speaker: Narrator

text: that our oxen may be strong to labor, that there be no breaking in, nor going out, that there be no complaining in our streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is that people for whom such is the case; yea, happy is that people whose God is the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will extol Thee, my God, O King; and I will bless Thy name for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every day will I bless Thee, and I will praise Thy name for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is the Lord and greatly to be praised, and His greatness is unsearchable.
speaker: Narrator

text: One generation shall praise Thy works to another, and shall declare Thy mighty acts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will speak of the glorious honor of Thy majesty, and of Thy wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: And men shall speak of the might of Thy fearsome acts, and I will declare Thy greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall abundantly utter the memory of Thy great goodness, and shall sing of Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is gracious and full of compassion, slow to anger and of great mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is good to all, and His tender mercies are over all His works.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Thy works shall praise Thee, O Lord, and Thy saints shall bless Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall speak of the glory of Thy Kingdom and talk of Thy power,
speaker: Narrator

text: to make known to the sons of men His mighty acts and the glorious majesty of His Kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy Kingdom is an everlasting Kingdom, and Thy dominion endureth throughout all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that are bowed down.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of all wait upon Thee, and Thou givest them their meat in due season.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou openest Thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is righteous in all His ways, and holy in all His works.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon Him, to all that call upon Him in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will fulfill the desire of them that fear Him; He also will hear their cry and will save them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord preserveth all them that love Him, but all the wicked will He destroy.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord, and let all flesh bless His holy name for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord! Praise the Lord, O my soul!
speaker: Narrator

text: While I live will I praise the Lord; I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put not your trust in princes, nor in a son of man in whom there is no help.
speaker: Narrator

text: His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very day his thoughts perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the Lord his God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who made heaven and earth, the sea and all that therein is, who keepeth truth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: who executeth judgment for the oppressed, who giveth food to the hungry; the Lord looseth the prisoners.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord openeth the eyes of the blind; the Lord raiseth them that are bowed down; the Lord loveth the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord preserveth the strangers, He relieveth the fatherless and the widow; but the way of the wicked He turneth upside down.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall reign for ever, even Thy God, O Zion, unto all generations. Praise ye the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord! For it is good to sing praises unto our God; for it is pleasant, and praise is comely.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord doth build up Jerusalem; He gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.
speaker: Narrator

text: He telleth the number of the stars; He calleth them all by their names.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is our Lord, and of great power; His understanding is infinite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord lifteth up the meek; He casteth the wicked down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who covereth the heavens with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: He giveth to the beast his food and to the young ravens which cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: He delighteth not in the strength of the horse; He taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord taketh pleasure in them that fear Him, in those that hope in His mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem! Praise thy God, O Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; He hath blessed thy children within thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh peace in thy borders, and filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth forth His commandment upon the earth; His word runneth very swiftly.
speaker: Narrator

text: He giveth snow like wool; He scattereth the hoarfrost like ashes;
speaker: Narrator

text: He casteth forth His ice like morsels; who can stand before His cold?
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth out His word, and melteth them; He causeth His wind to blow, and the waters flow.
speaker: Narrator

text: He showeth His word unto Jacob, His statutes and His judgments unto Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath not dealt so with any nation; and as for His judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord! Praise ye the Lord from the heavens; praise Him in the heights!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Him, all His angels; praise ye Him, all His hosts!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Him, sun and moon; praise Him, all ye stars of light!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that be above the heavens!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise the name of the Lord, for He commanded and they were created.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath also established them for ever and ever; He hath made a decree which shall not pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord from the earth, ye dragons and all deeps,
speaker: Narrator

text: fire and hail, snow and vapors, stormy wind fulfilling His word,
speaker: Narrator

text: mountains and all hills, fruitful trees and all cedars,
speaker: Narrator

text: beasts and all cattle, creeping things and flying fowl,
speaker: Narrator

text: kings of the earth and all people, princes and all judges of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: both young men and maidens, old men and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise the name of the Lord, for His name alone is excellent; His glory is above the earth and heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also exalteth the horn of His people, the praise of all His saints, even of the children of Israel, a people near unto Him. Praise ye the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord! Sing unto the Lord a new song, and His praise in the congregation of saints!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel rejoice in Him that made him; let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise His name in the dance; let them sing praises unto Him with the timbrel and harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord taketh pleasure in His people; He will beautify the meek with salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the saints be joyful in glory; let them sing aloud upon their beds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand
speaker: Narrator

text: to execute vengeance upon the heathen, and punishments upon the people;
speaker: Narrator

text: to bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;
speaker: Narrator

text: to execute upon them the judgment written: this honor have all His saints. Praise ye the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord! Praise God in His sanctuary; praise Him in the firmament of His power!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him for His mighty acts; praise Him according to His excellent greatness!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him with the sound of the trumpet; praise Him with the psaltery and harp!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him with the timbrel and dance; praise Him with stringed instruments and organs!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him upon the loud cymbals; praise Him upon the high sounding cymbals!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let everything that hath breath praise the Lord! Praise ye the Lord!
speaker: Narrator
